page.title: 03Farm Conservation, Horsted.
page.content: The Manager of Little Horsted Estate is aware of the need to{conserve}areas of the farm. Since 1976 a variety of projects have been undertaken. A{pond}has been re_created from the remains of a lake. Water-weeds,rushes, bulrushes,willow and others are now established along with coot,mallard, moorhen,frogs and Canada Geese. Silver birch,cherry and willow were planted on the north bank. Another pond has been dug which has an island left for nesting. Over 100 trees were planted. A field has been left in its{rough {natural state}for the past{50}years. There are at least 68 different kinds of grasses and flowers. Twelve acres of a special variety of old wheat are grown for{corn dolly {making.}The old binder has been rest- ored and in August corn sheaves can be seen stooked in the old way.
